sen.j: 大内 教弘（おおうち のりひろ、1420年5月2日（応永27年3月20日 (旧暦)） - 1465年9月23日（寛正6年9月3日 (旧暦)））は、室町時代中期の守護大名。
sen.e: Norihiro OUCHI (May 2, 1420 - Sept. 23, 1465) was Shugo (Military Govenor) Daimyo in the middle of Muromachi period.
Norihiro OUCHI (May 2, 1420 - Sept. 23, 1465) was Shugo (Military Govenor) Daimyo in the middle of the Muromachi period.
Norihiro OUCHI (May 11, 1420 - October 2, 1465) was Shugo (Military Governor) Daimyo in the middle of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Governorスペル訂正しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。

sen.e: He was the 13th family head of the Ouchi clan.
He was the 13th family head of the Ouchi clan.
He was the 13th family head of the Ouchi clan.

sen.j: 第11代当主・大内盛見の子（一説には大内持盛の次男）。
sen.e: He was a son of the 11th family head, Morimi OUCHI (although he was regarded as the second son of Mochimori OUCHI in another view).
He was a son of the 11th family head, Morimi OUCHI (although he was regarded as the second son of Mochimori OUCHI in another view).
He was a son of the 11th family head, Morimi OUCHI (although he was regarded as the second son of Mochimori OUCHI in another view).
The original surname was Tatara.
The original surname was Tatara.
The original surname was Tatara.

sen.j: 家系は周防の百済の聖明王の血筋を自称し、在庁官人の系譜をひく大内氏。
sen.e: The Ouchi clan, who described itself as a family line related by blood to Shomyoo of Kudara (Paekche) in Suo Province, was descended from Zaichokanjin (the local officials in Heian and Kamakura periods).

The Ouchi clan, who described itself as a family line related by blood to Shomyoo of Kudara (Paekche) in Suo Province, was descended from Zaichokanjin (the local officials in Heian and Kamakura periods).

The Ouchi clan, who described itself as a family line related by blood to King Songmyong of Paekche in Suo Province, was descended from Zaichokanjin (the local officials in Heian and Kamakura periods).
sen.cmt: 聖明王→King Songmyong百済の日本語読みは不要と考え削除しました。

sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Mochitoyo YAMANA.
His wife was a daughter of Mochitoyo YAMANA.
His wife was a daughter of Mochitoyo YAMANA.

sen.j: 官位は左京大夫、大膳大夫。
sen.e: He was granted official court rank of Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
sen.cmt: 二文を一文にしています。
sen.e: He was granted official court rank of Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
He was granted official court rank of Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).

sen.j: 第12代当主・大内持世の養嗣子となる、1441年、持世が嘉吉の乱に巻き込まれて死去したため、その後を継いで当主となり、周防国・長門国・筑前国・豊前国の四ヶ国を領する。
sen.e: He was the adoptive heir of the 12th family head, Mochiyo OUCHI in 1441 to succeed the family head who controlled four provinces--Suo Province, Nagato Province, Chikuzen Province, and Buzen Province--because Mochiyo was involved in Kakitsu War and died.

He was the adoptive heir of the 12th family head, Mochiyo OUCHI in 1441 to succeed the family head who controlled four provinces--Suo Province, Nagato Province, Chikuzen Province, and Buzen Province--because Mochiyo was involved in Kakitsu War and died.

He was the adoptive heir of the 12th family head, Mochiyo OUCHI in 1441 to succeed the family head who controlled four provinces, Suo Province, Nagato Province, Chikuzen Province, and Buzen Province, because Mochiyo was involved in Kakitsu War and died.

sen.j: 当主就任後は幕命に従って少弐教頼と交戦した。
sen.e: After assuming the family head, he obeyed an order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to fight with Noriori SHONI
After assuming the family head, he obeyed an order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to fight with Noriori SHONI
After assuming the family head, he obeyed an order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to fight with Noriori SHONI.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 宗氏を頼って対馬へ逃れた少弐氏を討伐するために朝鮮に対して対馬の割譲を提言している。
sen.e: He proposed Korea to cede the territory of Tsushima to defeat the SHONI clan who had relied on the So clan and run away toTsushima.
He proposed Korea to cede the territory of Tsushima to defeat the SHONI clan who had relied on the So clan and ran away toTsushima.
He proposed Korea to cede the territory of Tsushima to defeat the Shoni clan who had relied on the So clan and ran away to Tsushima.
sen.cmt: Shoni小文字にしました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 安芸国で武田氏と戦い、大内氏の勢力を安芸・石見国・肥前国に拡大した。
sen.e: He fought with Takeda clan in Aki Province, extending its power to the Provinces of Aki, Iwami, and Bizen.
He fought with Takeda clan in Aki Province, extending its power to the Provinces of Aki, Iwami, and Bizen.
He fought with Takeda clan in Aki Province, extending its power to the Provinces of Aki, Iwami, and Bizen.

sen.j: 細川氏と李氏朝鮮との交易（日朝貿易）をめぐって争ったが、これに勝利して朝鮮と通交する。
sen.e: He won in a dispute with the Hosokawa clan over a foreign trade (Japan-Korea Trade) with Joseon Dynasty and had relations with Korea.
He won in a dispute with the Hosokawa clan over a foreign trade (Japan-Korea Trade) with Joseon Dynasty and had relations with Korea.
He won in a dispute with the Hosokawa clan over a foreign trade (Japan-Korea Trade) with Joseon Dynasty and had relations with Korea.

sen.j: また、文化に対しても造詣が深く、雪舟を招聘して明に渡海させようとした。
sen.e: He also had a profound knowledge of culture and invited SESSHU to dispatch him to Ming.
He also had a profound knowledge of culture and invited SESSHU to dispatch him to Ming.
He also had a profound knowledge of culture and invited Sesshu to dispatch him to Ming.

sen.j: 交易（日明貿易、勘合貿易）上の争いなどから細川氏と敵対。
sen.e: He was opposed to the Hosokawa clan over foreign trade (Japan-Ming trade (the tally trade)).
He was opposed to the Hosokawa clan over foreign trade (Japan-Ming trade (the tally trade)).
He was opposed to the Hosokawa clan over foreign trade (Japan-Ming trade (the tally trade)).

sen.j: 細川氏と敵対していた伊予国の河野通春と手を結んで四国における細川勝元の軍に対して優位に戦ったが、1465年9月3日、興居島で死去。
sen.e: He joined hands with Michiharu KONO in Iyo Province, who also were in opposition to the Hosokawa clan, to take advantage in fighting with the forces of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, but died on September 3, 1465 in Gogo-shima Island.

He joined hands with Michiharu KONO in Iyo Province, who also were in opposition to the Hosokawa clan, to take advantage in fighting with the forces of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, but died on September 3, 1465 in Gogo-shima Island.

He joined hands with Michiharu KONO in Iyo Province, who also were in opposition to the Hosokawa clan, to take advantage in fighting with the forces of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, but died on September 3, 1465 in Gogo-shima Island.
He was 46 years old.
He was 46 years old.
He was 46 years old.

sen.j: 死後、家督は長男の大内政弘が継いだ。
sen.e: After his death, his first son, Masahiro OUCHI succeeded the family head.
After his death, his first son, Masahiro OUCHI succeeded as family head.
After his death, his first son, Masahiro OUCHI succeeded as family head.
